tags.name: QuantumView_other
tags.description:
UPS Quantum View is a suite of services that gives you and your customers details regarding UPS shipments.
Business Rules
Appendix
Errors
FAQ
GitHub - view sample integration code

requestBody.description: Generate sample code for popular API requests by selecting an example below. To view a full sample request and response, first click "Authorize" and enter your application credentials, then populate the required parameters above and click "Try it out".

oauth2.description:
Find your Client ID and Secret on your app info page.
1. Select \"Try It\"
2. In the Security section enter your Client ID and Secret.
3. Select \"Request Token\"
4. Enter any additional information in the Body and Parameters sections.
5. Select \"Send\" to execute your API request

Bookmark.description:
Bookmarks the file for next retrieval. It is a base64Encoded String. 
It contains the combination of SubscriberID + SubscriptionName + File Name if the request is for all data. 
It contains SubscriberID  if the request is for unread data. When a response comes back with a bookmark it indicates that there is more data. To fetch the remaining data, the requester should come back with the bookmark added to the original request.

RequestAction.description: Indicates the action to be taken by the XML service. The only valid value is  'QVEvents'

CustomerContext.description: Customer provided data.� May be XML. If this data is present in the request, it is echoed back to the customer.

Request_TransactionReference.description: TransactionReference identifies transactions between client and server.

TransactionReference_CustomerContext.description: Customer provided data.� May be XML. If this data is present in the request, it is echoed back to the customer.

Request_RequestAction.description: Indicates the action to be taken by the XML service. The only valid value is  'QVEvents'

Name.description: Name of subscription requested by user, as one type of request criteria. Required when the customer wants to request data for a specific subscription name. Subscription name consists of up to 21 alphanumerics.

FileName.description: File name of specific subscription requested by user. Format: YYMMDD_HHmmssnnn. (nnn - sequence number: usually = 001)

QuantumViewRequest_SubscriptionRequest.description: Subscription requested by user to retrieve Inbound or/and Outbound XML formed subscription information.

SubscriptionRequest_Name.description: Name of subscription requested by user, as one type of request criteria. Required when the customer wants to request data for a specific subscription name. Subscription name consists of up to 21 alphanumerics.

BeginDateTime.description: Beginning date time for the retrieval criteria of the subscriptions. It is required for date time request criteria. Format: YYYYMMDDHHmmss.

EndDateTime.description: Ending date time for the retrieval criteria of the subscriptions. Format: YYYYMMDDHHmmss.  When a null or empty EndDateTime is passed in the request, it is defaulted to 7 days from the given begin date.

SubscriptionRequest_DateTimeRange.description: The range of date time of subscription requested by user, as one type of request criteria, valid up to but not exceeding 7 days into the past, starting from current day.

DateTimeRange_BeginDateTime.description: Beginning date time for the retrieval criteria of the subscriptions. It is required for date time request criteria. Format: YYYYMMDDHHmmss.

DateTimeRange_EndDateTime.description: Ending date time for the retrieval criteria of the subscriptions. Format: YYYYMMDDHHmmss.  When a null or empty EndDateTime is passed in the request, it is defaulted to 7 days from the given begin date.

SubscriptionRequest_FileName.description: File name of specific subscription requested by user. Format: YYMMDD_HHmmssnnn. (nnn - sequence number: usually = 001)

QuantumViewRequest_Bookmark.description:
Bookmarks the file for next retrieval. It is a base64Encoded String. 
It contains the combination of SubscriberID + SubscriptionName + File Name if the request is for all data. 
It contains SubscriberID  if the request is for unread data. When a response comes back with a bookmark it indicates that there is more data. To fetch the remaining data, the requester should come back with the bookmark added to the original request.

Bookmark.description: Bookmarks the file for next retrieval, It is a base64Encoded String. It contains the combination of SubscriberID + SubscriptionName + File Name if the request is for all data. It contains SubscriberID if the request is for unread data. When a response comes back with a bookmark it indicates that there is more data. To fetch the remaining data, the requester should come back with the bookmark added to the original request.

ResponseStatusCode.description:
Identifies the success or failure of the interchange. 
1 = Success, 0 = Failure

QuantumViewResponse_Response.description: Contains Errors information tags along with the success/fail status of the QuantumView request.

CustomerContext.description: Customer provided data.� May be XML. If this data is present in the request, it is echoed back to the customer.

Response_TransactionReference.description: Container for customer provided data and the XPCI Version.

Response_ResponseStatusCode.description:
Identifies the success or failure of the interchange. 
1 = Success, 0 = Failure

ErrorSeverity.description: Describes the severity of the error.�� Required if the error is present.

ErrorCode.description: A numeric value that describes the error.� Each tool defines a range of error codes. Required if the error is present.

MinimumRetrySeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait until retry.� This field is populated on special conditions of the Transient Error only, as defined by the service.� A number between 1 and 86400 (24 hours)

ErrorDigest.description: The contents of the element in error.

Response_Error.description: If an error is encountered during the interchange, the Response contains an error.� If the error is present, then the ErrorSeverity and ErrorCodes are required.

Error_ErrorSeverity.description: Describes the severity of the error.�� Required if the error is present.

Error_ErrorCode.description: A numeric value that describes the error.� Each tool defines a range of error codes. Required if the error is present.

Error_MinimumRetrySeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait until retry.� This field is populated on special conditions of the Transient Error only, as defined by the service.� A number between 1 and 86400 (24 hours)

ErrorLocationElementName.description: The Xpath name of the element in error.� This is a valid Xpath pointing to an element in the request document.

ErrorLocationAttributeName.description: The name of the attribute in error.� This is the name of the attribute contained by the Error Location element.

ErrorLocation_ErrorLocationElementName.description: The Xpath name of the element in error.� This is a valid Xpath pointing to an element in the request document.

ErrorLocation_ErrorLocationAttributeName.description: The name of the attribute in error.� This is the name of the attribute contained by the Error Location element.

Error_ErrorDigest.description: The contents of the element in error.

SubscriberID.description: QV XOLT subscribers ID. It is the same as the User ID.

QuantumViewResponse_QuantumViewEvents.description: The event that a user receives echoing Subscriber ID and information for subscription event, which is a subset of Tracking information specific to either packages coming or packages going, after subscription request is made, if the user requests for XML format.

QuantumViewEvents_SubscriberID.description: QV XOLT subscribers ID. It is the same as the User ID.

Name.description: A name uniquely defined associated to the Subscription ID, for each subscription.� Required if the SubscriptionEvents container is present.

Number.description: A number uniquely defined associated to the Subscriber ID, for each subscription.� Required if the SubscriptionEvents container is present.

QuantumViewEvents_SubscriptionEvents.description: The event that a user receives a subset of Tracking information specific to either packages coming or packages going, after subscription request is made.

SubscriptionEvents_Name.description: A name uniquely defined associated to the Subscription ID, for each subscription.� Required if the SubscriptionEvents container is present.

SubscriptionEvents_Number.description: A number uniquely defined associated to the Subscriber ID, for each subscription.� Required if the SubscriptionEvents container is present.

Code.description:
Status types of subscription. 
Valid values:
UN � Unknown
AT � Activate
P � Pending
A �Active
I � Inactive
S - Suspended

Description.description:
Description of a subscription. 
Valid values: 
- Unknown (Unknown subscription status)
- Activate (Ready for the user to activate the subscription)
- Pending (In the process of waiting for privilege requests authorization)
- Active (The subscription is in good standing and is active.)
- Inactive (The subscriber puts the subscription on hold.)
- Suspended (UPS disables the subscription.)

SubscriptionEvents_SubscriptionStatus.description: Container for whether the subscription is active or not.

SubscriptionStatus_Code.description:
Status types of subscription. 
Valid values:
UN � Unknown
AT � Activate
P � Pending
A �Active
I � Inactive
S - Suspended

SubscriptionStatus_Description.description:
Description of a subscription. 
Valid values: 
- Unknown (Unknown subscription status)
- Activate (Ready for the user to activate the subscription)
- Pending (In the process of waiting for privilege requests authorization)
- Active (The subscription is in good standing and is active.)
- Inactive (The subscriber puts the subscription on hold.)
- Suspended (UPS disables the subscription.)

BeginDate.description:
Beginning date time of subscription requested by user.
Format: MM-DD-YYYY-HH-MM

EndDate.description:
Ending date time of subscription requested by user.
Format: MM-DD-YYYY-HH-MM

SubscriptionEvents_DateRange.description: The range of date time of subscription requested by user, as one type of request criteria, valid up to but not exceeding 7 days into the past, starting from current day.

DateRange_BeginDate.description:
Beginning date time of subscription requested by user.
Format: MM-DD-YYYY-HH-MM

DateRange_EndDate.description:
Ending date time of subscription requested by user.
Format: MM-DD-YYYY-HH-MM

FileName.description:
File name belonging to specific subscription requested by user.
Format: YYMMDD_HHmmssnnn

SubscriptionEvents_SubscriptionFile.description: Container holds all of the unread files associated with the subscription.

SubscriptionFile_FileName.description:
File name belonging to specific subscription requested by user.
Format: YYMMDD_HHmmssnnn

Code.description:
Status types of subscription file. Valid values:
R � Read, U - Unread

SubscriptionFile_StatusType.description: Container that displays whether the file is read or unread.

StatusType_Code.description:
Status types of subscription file. Valid values:
R � Read, U - Unread

PickupDate.description: Should be set equal to the date on while the packages were picked up (may be prior days date if the transmission occurs after midnight). Formatted as YYYYMMDD.

ScheduledDeliveryDate.description: The date the shipment originally was scheduled for delivery. Formatted as YYYYMMDD.

ScheduledDeliveryTime.description: Schedule delivery time. Time format is HHMMSS

DocumentsOnly.description:
If the tag is present then the shipment is a document, otherwise the shipment is a non-document. 
Valid values:� 
1 = Letter
2 = Document (Non-Letter Document)
3 = Non-Document
4 = Pallet

ManufactureCountry.description: Country or Territory  of Manufacture of the contents of the package.

ShipmentChargeType.description:
Shipment charge type.
Valid values:
C/F - Cost and Freight
C/B - Consignee Billed Package
F/C - Freight Collect
DDP - Delivered Duty Paid
VAT Unpaid
FOB - Free On Board
P/P - Prepaid
F/D - Free Domicile
T/P - Third Party Billing

ConsigneeBillIndicator.description: Indicates if consignee will be billed the shipment.

CollectBillIndicator.description: Indicates whether or not to collect bill at time of delivery.

LocationAssured.description: Indicates Location Assured Values: Y - Location Assured accessorial requested

ImportControl.description: Import Control Indication is used to designate that the shipment is an Import Control shipment. If the shipment is an import control shipment then this element will have value. For no import shipment this will not be appear

LabelDeliveryMethod.description: Indicates Label Delivery Method, Values are: LDE Electronic Label .LDO One Attempt. LDP Print Label. LDT Three Attempt. LPM� Print and Mail Label.

CommercialInvoiceRemoval.description: Commercial Invoice Removal (CIR) is an accessorial or indication that will allow a shipper to dictate that UPS remove the Commercial Invoice from the user's shipment before the shipment is delivered to the ultimate consignee. If shipment is CIR then this element will have value. For no CIR this element will not be appear

PostalServiceTrackingID.description: Postal Service Tracking ID transport company tracking number.

ReturnsFlexibleAccess.description: (RFA) UPS returns flexible access. This element will appear with value only when returns flexible access uploaded. For no returns flexible access this element will not be appear

UPScarbonneutral.description: UPS carbon neutral is a term used to reflect a generic term for the tagging to be included on any document, label, e-mail, etc. used to identify that the UPS carbon neutral fee is applied. This element will appear only when shipment is UPS carbon neutral with value. For non UPS carbon neutral shipping this element appear.

Product.description: This element will have value �PAC� for CAR shipments. For no CAR shipments this element will not be appeared.

UPSReturnsExchange.description: UPS Return and Exchange � This element will appear with value Y only when UPS Return and Exchange was requested. For no UPS Returns and Exchange then this element will not be appeared

LiftGateOnDelivery.description: Lift Gate On Delivery - This element will appear only when Lift Gate For Delivery was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Lift Gate for Delivery was requested, this element will not appear.

LiftGateOnPickUp.description: Lift Gate On PickUp - This element will appear only when Lift Gate For PickUp was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Lift Gate for PickUp was requested, this element will not appear.

PickupPreference.description: Pickup Preference -This element will appear only when Dropoff At UPS Facility was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Dropoff At UPS Facility was requested, this element will not appear.

DeliveryPreference.description: Delivery Preference - This element will appear only when Hold for pick up was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Hold for pick up was requested, this element will not appear.

HoldForPickupAtUPSAccessPoint.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Direct to Retail.

DeliverToAddresseeOnlyIndicator.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Deliver to Addressee.

UPSAccessPointCODIndicator.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Cash on Delivery in Direct to Retail

ClinicalTrialIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Clinical Trial accessorial provided in Manifest. Spaces = Clinical Trial accessorial not provided in Manifest.

ClinicalTrialIndicationNumber.description: An unique Clinical Trial associated with the shipment provided in Manifest.

CategoryAHazardousIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Category A Hazardous materials accessorial provided in Manifest. Spaces = Category A Hazardous materials accessorial not provided in Manifest.

DirectDeliveryIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Direct Delivery accessorisal provided in Manifest. Spaces = Direct Delivery accessorial not provided in Manifest.

ProactiveResponseIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a UPS Proactive Response Accessorial is provided.

WhiteGloveDeliveryIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods White Glove Delivery Accessorial is provided.

RoomOfChoiceIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Room of Choice Accessorial is provided.

InstallationDeliveryIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Installation Delivery Accessorial is provided.

ItemDisposalIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Item Disposal Accessorial is provided.

UPSPremierAccessorialIndicator.description: �Y� indicates that the UPS Premier accessorial is provided.

UPSPremierCategoryCode.description: Indicates the UPS Premier category applied to the package Valid values: 'PRS' � UPS Premier Silver, 'PRG' � UPS Premier Gold, 'PRP' - UPS Premier Platinum

SubscriptionFile_Manifest.description: Container represents all data that is relevant for the shipment, such as origin, destination, shipper, payment method etc. It will be return when available.

PhoneNumber.description: Shipper's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

FaxNumber.description: Shipper's Fax Number. US Fax numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

ShipperNumber.description: Shipper's six digit alphanumeric account number.

Shipper_PhoneNumber.description: Shipper's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

Shipper_FaxNumber.description: Shipper's Fax Number. US Fax numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

Shipper_ShipperNumber.description: Shipper's six digit alphanumeric account number.

AddressLine1.description: Address Line 1 of the UPS Access Point.

AddressLine2.description: Address Line 2 of the UPS Access Point. Usually room/floor information.

AddressLine3.description: Address Line 3 of the UPS Access Point. Usually department information.

StateProvinceCode.description: UPS Access Point's state or province code. Must be valid US state. If the UPS Access Point country or territory is US or CA a two character code is required, otherwise, the StateProvinceCode is optional.

PostalCode.description: UPS Access Point's postal code. If the address is US then 5 or 9 digits are required. CA addresses must provide a 6 character postal code that has the format of A#A#A#, where A is an alphabetic character and # is numeric digit. Otherwise, 1 to 16 alphanumeric characters are allowed.

CountryCode.description: UPS Access Point's country or territory code. Valid values: CA,MX, PR, US, AT, BE, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, IE, IT, NL, PT, SE, MC, and VA

ResidentialAddressIndicator.description: If tag is present, then the address is residential address. Pickup location residential address indicator. The presence indicates residential address, the absence indicates a business address.

Shipper_Address.description: Information that specifies a physical location.

Address_AddressLine1.description: Address Line 1 of the UPS Access Point.

Address_AddressLine2.description: Address Line 2 of the UPS Access Point. Usually room/floor information.

Address_AddressLine3.description: Address Line 3 of the UPS Access Point. Usually department information.

Address_StateProvinceCode.description: UPS Access Point's state or province code. Must be valid US state. If the UPS Access Point country or territory is US or CA a two character code is required, otherwise, the StateProvinceCode is optional.

Address_PostalCode.description: UPS Access Point's postal code. If the address is US then 5 or 9 digits are required. CA addresses must provide a 6 character postal code that has the format of A#A#A#, where A is an alphabetic character and # is numeric digit. Otherwise, 1 to 16 alphanumeric characters are allowed.

Address_CountryCode.description: UPS Access Point's country or territory code. Valid values: CA,MX, PR, US, AT, BE, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, IE, IT, NL, PT, SE, MC, and VA

Address_ResidentialAddressIndicator.description: If tag is present, then the address is residential address. Pickup location residential address indicator. The presence indicates residential address, the absence indicates a business address.

ShipperAssignedIdentificationNumber.description: An identification number specified by shipper.

AttentionName.description: Contact name at the consignee's location.

PhoneNumber.description: Consignee's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

FaxNumber.description: Consignee's Fax Number. US Fax numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

LocationID.description: Location name that the package is shipped to.

ReceivingAddressName.description: Alias of the location where the package is received.

Manifest_ShipTo.description: Address and contact information describing the location where a return is to be delivered.

ShipTo_ShipperAssignedIdentificationNumb.description: An identification number specified by shipper.

ShipTo_AttentionName.description: Contact name at the consignee's location.

ShipTo_PhoneNumber.description: Consignee's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

ShipTo_FaxNumber.description: Consignee's Fax Number. US Fax numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

AddressLine1.description: Address Line 1 of the UPS Access Point.

AddressLine2.description: Address Line 2 of the UPS Access Point. Usually room/floor information.

AddressLine3.description: Address Line 3 of the UPS Access Point. Usually department information.

StateProvinceCode.description: UPS Access Point's state or province code. Must be valid US state. If the UPS Access Point country or territory is US or CA a two character code is required, otherwise, the StateProvinceCode is optional.

PostalCode.description: UPS Access Point's postal code. If the address is US then 5 or 9 digits are required. CA addresses must provide a 6 character postal code that has the format of A#A#A#, where A is an alphabetic character and # is numeric digit. Otherwise, 1 to 16 alphanumeric characters are allowed.

CountryCode.description: UPS Access Point's country or territory code. Valid values: CA,MX, PR, US, AT, BE, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, IE, IT, NL, PT, SE, MC, and VA

ShipTo_Address.description: Information that specifies a physical location.

ShipTo_LocationID.description: Location name that the package is shipped to.

ShipTo_ReceivingAddressName.description: Alias of the location where the package is received.

Code.description:
Reference number type code for entire shipment, two-character alphanumeric. 
The code specifies the Reference name. 
Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.
For additional information, refer to the Reference Codes table in the Appendix.

Value.description: Customer supplied reference number, defined by the shipper and can contain any character string. Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.

ReferenceNumber_Code.description:
Reference number type code for entire shipment, two-character alphanumeric. 
The code specifies the Reference name. 
Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.
For additional information, refer to the Reference Codes table in the Appendix.

ReferenceNumber_Value.description: Customer supplied reference number, defined by the shipper and can contain any character string. Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.

Code.description: For addition information, refer to the Service Codes table in the Appendix.

Manifest_Service.description: Container for service code and description.

Service_Code.description: For addition information, refer to the Service Codes table in the Appendix.

Manifest_PickupDate.description: Should be set equal to the date on while the packages were picked up (may be prior days date if the transmission occurs after midnight). Formatted as YYYYMMDD.

Manifest_ScheduledDeliveryDate.description: The date the shipment originally was scheduled for delivery. Formatted as YYYYMMDD.

Manifest_ScheduledDeliveryTime.description: Schedule delivery time. Time format is HHMMSS

Manifest_DocumentsOnly.description:
If the tag is present then the shipment is a document, otherwise the shipment is a non-document. 
Valid values:� 
1 = Letter
2 = Document (Non-Letter Document)
3 = Non-Document
4 = Pallet

LargePackage.description: Values for LargePackage are:1 - Oversize 1,� 2 - Oversize 2,� 4 - Large package

UPSPremiumCareIndicator.description: Presence of the tag indicates UPSPremiumCare applies to this package

Date.description: Date of package activity (i.e. YYYYMMDD).� If generic record ActivityType is TC then event date is the date of first USPS scan.

Time.description: Time of package activity(i.e. HHMMSS).� If generic record ActivityType is TC then event time is the time of first USPS scan.

Activity_Date.description: Date of package activity (i.e. YYYYMMDD).� If generic record ActivityType is TC then event date is the date of first USPS scan.

Activity_Time.description: Time of package activity(i.e. HHMMSS).� If generic record ActivityType is TC then event time is the time of first USPS scan.

Length.description:
Package length. 
Valid values: 0 to 108 IN and 0 to 270 CM

Package_Dimensions.description:
Container tag for package dimension information. 
Length + 2 * (Width + Height) must be less than or equal to 130 IN or 330 CM.

Dimensions_Length.description:
Package length. 
Valid values: 0 to 108 IN and 0 to 270 CM

Weight.description: The value of package dimensional weight. A value of zero should be used for letters.

Package_DimensionalWeight.description: Container tag for package dimensional weight.

Code.description:
The code representing the unit of measure associated with the shipment's dimensional weight.
Valid values:
LBS - Pounds (default)
KGS - Kilograms
Defaults Unit of Measurement used in the shipper's country or territory.

Description.description: A text description of the code representing the unit of measure associated with the package weight.

DimensionalWeight_UnitOfMeasurement.description: Container tag for package dimensional weight measurement units.

UnitOfMeasurement_Code.description:
The code representing the unit of measure associated with the shipment's dimensional weight.
Valid values:
LBS - Pounds (default)
KGS - Kilograms
Defaults Unit of Measurement used in the shipper's country or territory.

UnitOfMeasurement_Description.description: A text description of the code representing the unit of measure associated with the package weight.

DimensionalWeight_Weight.description: The value of package dimensional weight. A value of zero should be used for letters.

Weight.description: Package weight. Set to 0 for package type of letters or envelops.

Package_PackageWeight.description: Container tag for package weight. Required when the package type is not UPS Letter.

PackageWeight_Weight.description: Package weight. Set to 0 for package type of letters or envelops.

Package_LargePackage.description: Values for LargePackage are:1 - Oversize 1,� 2 - Oversize 2,� 4 - Large package

Code.description:
Reference number type code for entire shipment, two-character alphanumeric. 
The code specifies the Reference name. 
Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.
For additional information, refer to the Reference Codes table in the Appendix.

Value.description: Customer supplied reference number, defined by the shipper and can contain any character string. Valid if the origin/destination pair is US/US or PR/PR.

Package_ReferenceNumber.description: Container tag for information about the package-level reference number.

EarliestDeliveryTime.description: Earliest delivery time. Time format is HHMMSS.

HazardousMaterialsCode.description:
Indicates if the package contains hazardous materials. 
Valid values: 
1 - Hazardous Material
2 - Electronically billed hazardous material.�
If present, only one package may exist in the shipment.

HoldForPickup.description: A flag indicating if a package should be held for pickup. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

AddShippingChargesToCODIndicator.description: An indicator flag that represents a Collect on Delivery (COD) package.

Package_PackageServiceOptions.description: Defines service options used for the package(s).

CODCode.description:
The code associated with the type of COD. Valid values:
1 - Regular COD
2 - Express COD
3 - Tagless COD

PackageServiceOptions_COD.description: Container for cash on delivery (COD) information.

COD_CODCode.description:
The code associated with the type of COD. Valid values:
1 - Regular COD
2 - Express COD
3 - Tagless COD

CurrencyCode.description:
The IATA currency code associated with the COD amount for the package. Required if the value for COD amount exists in MonetaryValue tag. Must match one of the IATA currency codes. 
For additional information, refer to Currency Codes in the Appendix for valid values.

MonetaryValue.description: The COD value for the package. Required if CODCode is 1.Absolute maximum value is for a 32 bit float is� 3.40282347e+38f.

COD_CODAmount.description: The monetary amount of the COD.

CODAmount_CurrencyCode.description:
The IATA currency code associated with the COD amount for the package. Required if the value for COD amount exists in MonetaryValue tag. Must match one of the IATA currency codes. 
For additional information, refer to Currency Codes in the Appendix for valid values.

CODAmount_MonetaryValue.description: The COD value for the package. Required if CODCode is 1.Absolute maximum value is for a 32 bit float is� 3.40282347e+38f.

MonetaryValue.description: The monetary value for the insured value amount associated with the package. Max value of 5,000 USD for Local and 50,000 USD for Remote.

PackageServiceOptions_InsuredValue.description: Container tag for insured value amount for the package.

InsuredValue_MonetaryValue.description: The monetary value for the insured value amount associated with the package. Max value of 5,000 USD for Local and 50,000 USD for Remote.

PackageServiceOptions_EarliestDeliveryTi.description: Earliest delivery time. Time format is HHMMSS.

PackageServiceOptions_HazardousMaterials.description:
Indicates if the package contains hazardous materials. 
Valid values: 
1 - Hazardous Material
2 - Electronically billed hazardous material.�
If present, only one package may exist in the shipment.

PackageServiceOptions_HoldForPickup.description: A flag indicating if a package should be held for pickup. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

Package_UPSPremiumCareIndicator.description: Presence of the tag indicates UPSPremiumCare applies to this package

SaturdayPickup.description: A flag indicating if the shipment requires a Saturday pickup. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

SaturdayDelivery.description: A flag indicating if the shipment requires a Saturday Delivery. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

Manifest_ShipmentServiceOptions.description: Container tag for optional UPS services related to a shipment.

ShipmentServiceOptions_SaturdayPickup.description: A flag indicating if the shipment requires a Saturday pickup. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

ShipmentServiceOptions_SaturdayDelivery.description: A flag indicating if the shipment requires a Saturday Delivery. True if tag exists, false otherwise.

Number.description: A reference number associated with the Call Tag service. Required if CallTagARS/Code is 1.

Code.description:
The type of Call Tag service. 
Valid values:
00 - No return service
01 - UPS Call Tag Service
02 - UPS Print and Mail
03 - 1 UPS Pickup Attempt
04 - UPS Print Return Label
05 - Online Call Tag (3 UPS Pickup Attempts)
06 - UPS Electronic Return Label
08 - UPS Returns on the Web

CallTagARS_Number.description: A reference number associated with the Call Tag service. Required if CallTagARS/Code is 1.

CallTagARS_Code.description:
The type of Call Tag service. 
Valid values:
00 - No return service
01 - UPS Call Tag Service
02 - UPS Print and Mail
03 - 1 UPS Pickup Attempt
04 - UPS Print Return Label
05 - Online Call Tag (3 UPS Pickup Attempts)
06 - UPS Electronic Return Label
08 - UPS Returns on the Web

Manifest_ManufactureCountry.description: Country or Territory  of Manufacture of the contents of the package.

Manifest_ShipmentChargeType.description:
Shipment charge type.
Valid values:
C/F - Cost and Freight
C/B - Consignee Billed Package
F/C - Freight Collect
DDP - Delivered Duty Paid
VAT Unpaid
FOB - Free On Board
P/P - Prepaid
F/D - Free Domicile
T/P - Third Party Billing

Option.description:
Indicates how shipping charges for the package were billed. 
Valid Values: 01, 02, 03, 04, 99 
Value Definitions: 
01 Shipper
02 Consignee Billing 
03 Third Party
04 Freight Collect
99 International Bill Option

Number.description: The UPS Account number to which the shipping charges were billed.

Manifest_BillToAccount.description: The information provided within this container identifies the shipper number and billing option the user specified to view during the subscription process.

BillToAccount_Option.description:
Indicates how shipping charges for the package were billed. 
Valid Values: 01, 02, 03, 04, 99 
Value Definitions: 
01 Shipper
02 Consignee Billing 
03 Third Party
04 Freight Collect
99 International Bill Option

BillToAccount_Number.description: The UPS Account number to which the shipping charges were billed.

Manifest_ConsigneeBillIndicator.description: Indicates if consignee will be billed the shipment.

Manifest_CollectBillIndicator.description: Indicates whether or not to collect bill at time of delivery.

Manifest_LocationAssured.description: Indicates Location Assured Values: Y - Location Assured accessorial requested

Manifest_ImportControl.description: Import Control Indication is used to designate that the shipment is an Import Control shipment. If the shipment is an import control shipment then this element will have value. For no import shipment this will not be appear

Manifest_LabelDeliveryMethod.description: Indicates Label Delivery Method, Values are: LDE Electronic Label .LDO One Attempt. LDP Print Label. LDT Three Attempt. LPM� Print and Mail Label.

Manifest_CommercialInvoiceRemoval.description: Commercial Invoice Removal (CIR) is an accessorial or indication that will allow a shipper to dictate that UPS remove the Commercial Invoice from the user's shipment before the shipment is delivered to the ultimate consignee. If shipment is CIR then this element will have value. For no CIR this element will not be appear

Manifest_PostalServiceTrackingID.description: Postal Service Tracking ID transport company tracking number.

Manifest_ReturnsFlexibleAccess.description: (RFA) UPS returns flexible access. This element will appear with value only when returns flexible access uploaded. For no returns flexible access this element will not be appear

Manifest_UPScarbonneutral.description: UPS carbon neutral is a term used to reflect a generic term for the tagging to be included on any document, label, e-mail, etc. used to identify that the UPS carbon neutral fee is applied. This element will appear only when shipment is UPS carbon neutral with value. For non UPS carbon neutral shipping this element appear.

Manifest_Product.description: This element will have value �PAC� for CAR shipments. For no CAR shipments this element will not be appeared.

Manifest_UPSReturnsExchange.description: UPS Return and Exchange � This element will appear with value Y only when UPS Return and Exchange was requested. For no UPS Returns and Exchange then this element will not be appeared

Manifest_LiftGateOnDelivery.description: Lift Gate On Delivery - This element will appear only when Lift Gate For Delivery was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Lift Gate for Delivery was requested, this element will not appear.

Manifest_LiftGateOnPickUp.description: Lift Gate On PickUp - This element will appear only when Lift Gate For PickUp was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Lift Gate for PickUp was requested, this element will not appear.

Manifest_PickupPreference.description: Pickup Preference -This element will appear only when Dropoff At UPS Facility was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Dropoff At UPS Facility was requested, this element will not appear.

Manifest_DeliveryPreference.description: Delivery Preference - This element will appear only when Hold for pick up was requested for UPS World Wide Express Freight Shipments. If no Hold for pick up was requested, this element will not appear.

Manifest_HoldForPickupAtUPSAccessPoint.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Direct to Retail.

CompanyName.description: The name of person or company to whom package was shipped.

AttentionName.description: The "Attention To" field for the person/company to whom package is shipped.

PhoneNumber.description: UPS Access Point's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

Manifest_UAPAddress.description: Information about Hold for Pickup UPS Access Point Address

UAPAddress_CompanyName.description: The name of person or company to whom package was shipped.

UAPAddress_AttentionName.description: The "Attention To" field for the person/company to whom package is shipped.

AddressLine1.description: Address Line 1 of the UPS Access Point.

AddressLine2.description: Address Line 2 of the UPS Access Point. Usually room/floor information.

AddressLine3.description: Address Line 3 of the UPS Access Point. Usually department information.

StateProvinceCode.description: UPS Access Point's state or province code. Must be valid US state. If the UPS Access Point country or territory is US or CA a two character code is required, otherwise, the StateProvinceCode is optional.

PostalCode.description: UPS Access Point's postal code. If the address is US then 5 or 9 digits are required. CA addresses must provide a 6 character postal code that has the format of A#A#A#, where A is an alphabetic character and # is numeric digit. Otherwise, 1 to 16 alphanumeric characters are allowed.

CountryCode.description: UPS Access Point's country or territory code. Valid values: CA,MX, PR, US, AT, BE, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, IE, IT, NL, PT, SE, MC, and VA

UAPAddress_Address.description: Information that specifies a physical location.

UAPAddress_PhoneNumber.description: UPS Access Point's Phone Number. US Phone numbers must be 10 digits. No formatting is allowed. Required if origin and destination countries or territories are different.

Manifest_DeliverToAddresseeOnlyIndicator.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Deliver to Addressee.

Manifest_UPSAccessPointCODIndicator.description: "Y" Indicates Shipment is Cash on Delivery in Direct to Retail

Manifest_ClinicalTrialIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Clinical Trial accessorial provided in Manifest. Spaces = Clinical Trial accessorial not provided in Manifest.

Manifest_ClinicalTrialIndicationNumber.description: An unique Clinical Trial associated with the shipment provided in Manifest.

Manifest_CategoryAHazardousIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Category A Hazardous materials accessorial provided in Manifest. Spaces = Category A Hazardous materials accessorial not provided in Manifest.

Manifest_DirectDeliveryIndicator.description: An accessorial Indicator flag: Y = Direct Delivery accessorisal provided in Manifest. Spaces = Direct Delivery accessorial not provided in Manifest.

Manifest_ProactiveResponseIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a UPS Proactive Response Accessorial is provided.

Manifest_WhiteGloveDeliveryIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods White Glove Delivery Accessorial is provided.

Manifest_RoomOfChoiceIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Room of Choice Accessorial is provided.

Manifest_InstallationDeliveryIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Installation Delivery Accessorial is provided.

Manifest_ItemDisposalIndicator.description: "Y" indicates that a Heavy Goods Item Disposal Accessorial is provided.

Manifest_UPSPremierAccessorialIndicator.description: �Y� indicates that the UPS Premier accessorial is provided.

Manifest_UPSPremierCategoryCode.description: Indicates the UPS Premier category applied to the package Valid values: 'PRS' � UPS Premier Silver, 'PRG' � UPS Premier Gold, 'PRP' - UPS Premier Platinum

ShipperNumber.description: Shipper's six digit alphanumeric account number.

Date.description: Date that the package is picked up at the origin. Date format is YYYYMMDD.

Time.description: Time that the package is picked up at the origin. Time format is HHMMSS.

ScheduledDeliveryDate.description: Scheduled delivery date for destination address. Date format is YYYYMMDD.

ScheduledDeliveryTime.description: Scheduled delivery time for destination address. Time format is HHMMSS.

01 Shipper

04 Freight Collect

Number.description: The UPS Account number to which the shipping charges were billed.

Delivery_BillToAccount.description: The information provided within this container identifies the shipper number and billing option the user specified to view during the subscription process.

Delivery_LastPickupDate.description: Last pickup by Date from the UPS Access Point Location.

ActivityType.description:
Unique identifier that defines the type of activity. 
VM = Void for Manifest 
UR = Undeliverable Returns
IR = Invoice Removal Successful 
TC = Transport Company USPS scan PS = 'Postal Service Possession Scan'
FN = UPS Access Point/Alternate Delivery Location Email Notification Failure
DS = Destination Scan
AG = Package is in transit to a UPS facility
RE = UPS Returns Exchange 
RP = Retail Pickup
UD = Updated delivery date                                                                                              OD = Out for Delivery                                                                                                        SD = Scheduled for Delivery                                                                                              FM = Tendered to FMP

RescheduledDeliveryDate.description:
If Activity Type is "DS" or "UD", this element will contain Rescheduled Delivery Date. 
Format will be YYYYMMDD.                                                                                               If Activity Type is "OD", this element will contain Rescheduled Delivery Date. Format will be YYYYMMDD.                                                                                                                     If Activity Type is "SD", this element will contain agreed upon date with Customer for delivery Date . Format will be YYYYMMDD.

Generic_ActivityType.description:
Unique identifier that defines the type of activity. 
VM = Void for Manifest 
UR = Undeliverable Returns
IR = Invoice Removal Successful 
TC = Transport Company USPS scan PS = 'Postal Service Possession Scan'
FN = UPS Access Point/Alternate Delivery Location Email Notification Failure
DS = Destination Scan
AG = Package is in transit to a UPS facility
RE = UPS Returns Exchange 
RP = Retail Pickup
UD = Updated delivery date                                                                                              OD = Out for Delivery                                                                                                        SD = Scheduled for Delivery                                                                                              FM = Tendered to FMP

Time.description: Time of package activity(i.e. HHMMSS).� If generic record ActivityType is TC then event time is the time of first USPS scan.

If Activity Type is "SD", this element will contain agreed upon date with Customer for delivery Date . Format will be YYYYMMDD.

FailedEmailAddress.description: Email address that failed when an attempt was made to send email to the customer

Generic_FailureNotification.description: Failure notification information containing email address and Notification code

FailureNotification_FailedEmailAddress.description: Email address that failed when an attempt was made to send email to the customer

Code.description:
Code representing type of failure email notification. Valid values:
01 � Package is ready to pickup at UPS Access Point - Original
02 � Package is ready to pickup at UPS Access Point - Reminder
03 � Package is delivery to alternate delivery location
04 �Package is returned to Sender from UPS Access Point Location

FailureNotification_FailureNotificationC.description: Failure notification code information describing code.

FailureNotificationCode_Code.description:
Code representing type of failure email notification. Valid values:
01 � Package is ready to pickup at UPS Access Point - Original
02 � Package is ready to pickup at UPS Access Point - Reminder
03 � Package is delivery to alternate delivery location
04 �Package is returned to Sender from UPS Access Point Location

QuantumViewResponse_Bookmark.description: Bookmarks the file for next retrieval, It is a base64Encoded String. It contains the combination of SubscriberID + SubscriptionName + File Name if the request is for all data. It contains SubscriberID if the request is for unread data. When a response comes back with a bookmark it indicates that there is more data. To fetch the remaining data, the requester should come back with the bookmark added to the original request.
